30.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Chad doesn't stand behind his cars. Key words: Car salesmen, guarantees.

31.heading: Chad.
31.title: "Can I Interest You in a Luxury Import?"
31.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Chad's practicing his car salesmanship, importing toy cars from the neighbors' backyard.

32.heading: Chad.
32.title: "Honest Professions"
32.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Instead of being a car salesman, Chad's mommy would like him to be in law or politics.

33.heading: Chad.
33.title: "I'm Glib and I Like to Fib"
33.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Chad's already qualified to run his dad's car dealership when he grows up.

84.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
84.title: "Almost a Stowaway!"
84.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: A boy tries to stow away in Tommy's airplane for the race to Tokyo.

85.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
85.title: "The Boys Welcome the DO-X!"
85.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Before setting out on their trip the racers watch the Dornier Flying Boat land near the Golden Gate.

86.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
86.title: "Dream of Future Veils Present Menace!"
86.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Guarding his oil well, Sid Temple daydreams of tropical leisure while a menacing figure approaches from behind.

87.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
87.title: "Enter Lady Q!"
87.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The mysterious woman pilot claims she's not in disguise for publicity purposes.

88.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
88.title: "The Girls Like Heroes!"
88.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: A crowd waits near Honolulu for the leaders of the race, but Tommy Tomkins' Cherry Blossom hasn't been heard from because of a damaged radio.

89.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
89.title: "It Takes Steady Nerves for This Trick!"
89.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter Milligan is planning to re-board the Cherry Blossom from a navy plane belonging to the carrier Saratoga.

90.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
90.title: "It's a Long Sit from Oakland to Tokio, Skeets!"
90.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Tommy Tomkins and Skeeter Milligan get the checkered flag, Tommy flying and Skeets at the radio.

91.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
91.title: "Must Be the Lady Q!"
91.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: In the radio room, the storm makes contact with the planes in the Oakland-Tokio race difficult.

92.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
92.title: "No Word from Tommy and Skeeter"
92.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: A crowd is watching for Tommy and Skeeter's three-point high-wing mono with one motor; a tri-motor comes into sight but that's not their Cherry Blossom.

93.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
93.title: "Nothing to Go On But Nerve!"
93.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter has fixed the motor, but it's still not running.

94.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
94.title: "On to the Orient!"
94.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: With gas and oil enough to make Tokio, the Cherry Blossom gives the Saratoga an airborne salute and Tommy and Skeeter are on their way.

95.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
95.title: "Plotting Their Course!"
95.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeets plays with the earth-inductor controller and gets them right on the radio beam; they pass the Farallon Islands.

96.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
96.title: "A Reward for Daring!"
96.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Tommy takes the plane low, almost into the ocean, before the motor restarts, and it's on to Hawaii and its ukeleles.

97.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
97.title: "Shooting the Well!"
97.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Sid drops the go-devil and the nitro-glycerin explodes in the oil well.

98.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
98.title: "Skeeter Blossoms Out!"
98.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter is knocked off the plane during mid-air refueling, and parachutes safely into the Pacific.

99.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
99.title: "Skeeter Overboard!"
99.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The trans-Pacific air derby is still on, but mid-air refueling above the navy carrier Saratoga is difficult because of rough flying conditions. Mention of Fay Wray.

100.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
100.title: "Skeeter the Doughty!"
100.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Skeeter has the navy wig-wag Tommy not to land, and asks for a suit of whites and a rope ladder.

101.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
101.title: "Skeeter's Faith in Tommy is Supreme!"
101.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: From another plane, Skeeter boards the Cherry Blossom in flight, using a rope ladder.

102.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
102.title: Tailspin Tommy: Index entry
102.author: [No author]
102.series: p. 184, 227) in America's Great Comic-Strip Artists, by Richard Marschall

103.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
103.title: "This May Mean a Forced Landing at Sea"
103.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Aboard the Cherry Blossom, the radio's on the fritz, an oil line's leaking, the motor's heating up, and the front glass is covered with oil so they can't see.

104.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
104.title: "Three-Point in the Running Again"
104.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: In Hawaii, three planes finish the first leg of the transPacific race together: the Lady Q, the Four Aces, and Tommy's three-point, the Cherry Blossom.

105.heading: Chaffin, Glenn.
105.title: "Vive les Pioneers!"
105.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: The last of the airplanes to Tokyo takes off from Oakland, and the newsreel crew compares the race with the pioneers in covered wagons, and with Lindbergh's flight.
